New Records: Netherlands won twice at the same World Cup for the first time
Key Match Events: Paul van Meekeren spearheaded the Netherlands' rout of Bangladesh with his career-best figures of 4/23.
Scott Edwards hit a match-winning 68 off 89 balls.
Taskin Ahmed was run out by Bas de Leede for 11 off 35 balls.
Mustafizur Rahman was bowled by Colin Ackermann for 20 off 35 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said they thought 220+ was a par score and they had a chance to win.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said they were sloppy in the field and should have restricted Netherlands to 160-170.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul van Meekeren said it was a pure team performance and they were confident after the halfway mark of their innings.
Shakib Al Hasan said they have been poor with the bat all tournament and this was as bad as it gets.
Scott Edwards said they feel like they are putting the work in and getting some rewards.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eden Gardens hosted its first game of the World Cup, which will be remembered for Netherlands' win.
Bangladesh's fielding was again a concern, with Edwards dropped twice in one over.
Others: The match was played at Eden Gardens, Kolkata, on October 28, 2023.
Netherlands' win means they will be looking to continue their momentum in the tournament.
